application.pane

Class PaneAnimator.Handler

  • java.lang.Object
    • application.pane.PaneAnimator.Handler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    PaneReplacer, java.util.EventListener, javafx.event.EventHandler
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    JavaFXAppHandler
    Enclosing interface:
    PaneAnimator

    public static class PaneAnimator.Handler
extends java.lang.Object
implements javafx.event.EventHandler, PaneReplacer
    Use this Class as a EventHandler for handling JavaFX Pane switches and Animations.

    • Field Summary

    • Field Detail

      • handle

        private javafx.beans.property.SimpleBooleanProperty handle
        This field determines whether to "arm" the ButtonBase or not.

        The Button should be armed only once.

        Indicates whether to invoke the handle(Event) method or not.

      • borderPaneToShowOnItsCenter

        private javafx.scene.layout.BorderPane borderPaneToShowOnItsCenter
        Stores here the BorderPane to show the new scene on its BorderPane.getCenter().

        Contains the Pane that is being replaced.

        private java.lang.Runnable runnable

    • Constructor Detail

      • Handler

        public Handler(javafx.scene.layout.BorderPane borderPaneToShowOnItsCenter,
               javafx.scene.layout.Pane parentContainer,
               java.lang.String pathToFXML,
               PaneAnimator.AnimationType animationType)
        Parameters:
        borderPaneToShowOnItsCenter - the BorderPane to show on its CENTER the newPane.
        parentContainer - the Parent Pane Container of the new scene to be shown.

        Note: this must be a Container that is able to use the Pane.getChildren() in order to add children to it.

        pathToFXML - the path to the .fxml file for the newPane to be shown.
        animationType - the type of Animation to be shown while transitioning between the replaceAblePane and the new Pane.

      • handle

        public void handle(javafx.event.Event event)
        Switch between the Panes. handle it with an Animation in between, according to the animationType provided.
        Specified by:
        handle in interface javafx.event.EventHandler
        Parameters:
        event - the encountered Event.
        See Also:
        PaneAnimator.AnimationType

      • handle

        public void handle(javafx.scene.control.ButtonBase buttonBase)

      • setPane

        private void setPane(javafx.event.Event event,
                     javafx.scene.layout.BorderPane borderPaneToShowOnItsCenter,
                     javafx.scene.layout.Pane parentContainer,
                     java.lang.String pathToFXML,
                     PaneAnimator.AnimationType animationType)
        This method sets the new Pane to be shown on a CENTER of the BorderPane and updates the Pane accordingly.

        Note: this implementation is using an Animation to switch between the Pane s, according to the user's decision.

        Parameters:
        event - the Event that triggers this method invocation.
        borderPaneToShowOnItsCenter - the BorderPane to show the Pane provided in the .fxml file.
        parentContainer - is a child of the provided BorderPane, and the Parent of the Pane that is being provided by the .fxml file.
        pathToFXML - path to the .fxml of the pane the user wishes to show.
        animationType - the Animation type that is able to be configured via PaneAnimator.AnimationType, and will determine the current switch of Panes Animation.
        See Also:
        PaneAnimator.AnimationType

      • armOnce

        public void armOnce(javafx.scene.control.ButtonBase buttonBase)
        important:

        Sets the ButtonBase to be pressed only once when "spam" clicking it.

        • Switches Panes once.
        • Invokes the runnable's Runnable.run()s once.
        Parameters:
        buttonBase - the ButtonBase to be configured.

      • runRunnable

        private void runRunnable(javafx.scene.control.ButtonBase buttonBase)
        Invoke the runnable's run() method, if there is any and if the ButtonBase is being pressed.
        Parameters:
        buttonBase - the ButtonBase that is being pressed.

      • handleOnce

        public void handleOnce(javafx.scene.control.ButtonBase buttonBase,
                       javafx.scene.layout.BorderPane borderPane,
                       javafx.scene.layout.Pane parentContainer,
                       PaneAnimator.AnimationType animationType,
                       java.lang.String pathToFXML)
        This method makes sure to handle(Event) a ButtonBase with an Animation, while enforcing the ButtonBase to be pressed at most once.

        This means, the user should not be able to "spam" click the ButtonBase.

        Parameters:
        buttonBase - the ButtonBase to be configured.
        borderPane - the BorderPane to show on its CENTER the newPane.
        parentContainer - the Parent Pane Container of the new scene to be shown.

        Note: this must be a Container that is able to use the Pane.getChildren() in order to add children to it.

        pathToFXML - the path to the .fxml file for the new scene to be shown.
        animationType - the type of Animation to be shown while transitioning between the replaceAblePane and the new Pane.

      • handleOnce

        public void handleOnce(javafx.scene.control.ButtonBase buttonBase)
